title: So apparently if you don't like a champion selection, just troll the guy and report him.
body: He'll get punished if enough jerks do the same thing.  True story.  Thanks for the genius mixture of an automated tribunal and the worst community in video games, Riot.

replies.body:
Let me give you a list of people who I have reported for their troll picks:

{{champion:2}} took him jg after I requested he pick literally any other jungler, said "I know what i'm doing Olaf is OP", proceeded to feed like I expected one of the weakest champs in the game to do.

{{champion:72}} took him jg built Devourer (before Cinderhulk even got nerfed) and zero tank items, absolutely useless to the team and was getting killed in the middle of his ult.

{{champion:17}} top and refused to put a single point into toxic shot until lvl 12, said "Mind your own business this is my OP strategy". Ended up going 0/6/0 against an Amumu top.

{{champion:27}} enemy singed locked in AP Singed mid AFTER Zed had first picked. Zed was forced to lane against my Nasus top and as you can guess, both me and my mid won lane and destroyed the enemy team.

{{champion:114}} last picked and said he only plays Fiora, so he took her support and was useless. Didn't even buy wards.

{{champion:266}} top, almost reported him but then he destroyed a {{champion:133}} top and got fed out of his mind, to the point that he bought an {{item:3031}} and singlehandedly decimated the enemy team. Honored him instead.
If people constantly report you for your pick, it means you're doing something that angers lots of people. This is a team game, start caring about the team.

> [{quoted}](name=Raptamei,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=rVf9lJEY,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-06-29T06:26:06.288+0000)
>
> If people constantly report you for your pick, it means you're doing something that angers lots of people. This is a team game, start caring about the team.

A champion selection does not give anyone the right to grief their teammates.  Nowhere in the summoners code did it say I will only play popular champs in popular roles.

> [{quoted}](name=InsaneSamurai,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=rVf9lJEY,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-06-29T06:56:01.478+0000)
>
> A champion selection does not give anyone the right to grief their teammates.  Nowhere in the summoners code did it say I will only play popular champs in popular roles.

Playing to win is expected of you in ranked. Picking bad champions on purpose is not playing to win.

> [{quoted}](name=Raptamei,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=rVf9lJEY,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-06-29T12:13:49.374+0000)
>
> Playing to win is expected of you in ranked. Picking bad champions on purpose is not playing to win.

You're one of them too, huh?

A champion isn't "bad" just because they aren't popular or in the meta.  My absolute best position is out of the meta and it is the best way I can contribute to winning a game.  So, playing to win is *exactly* what I'm doing.  Them trolling me for it is the opposite, only increasing the odds of losing because someone cant resist being a bigot and a jackass.
